condition.description:
Nausea and vomiting are common in early pregnancy and are often referred to as morning sickness. Some ways to prevent nausea and vomiting are

  • Avoid a very full stomach by eating smaller meals
  • Avoid an empty stomach (which can worsen nausea) by eating before or as soon as you're hungry
  • Try to avoid the things that trigger your symptoms, and eat more of the foods you can tolerate
  • Take a supplement that contains folic acid (which also helps prevent birth defects)

If you have morning sickness, there are several things you can try. Some people find acupressure wrist bands helpful. Some over-the-counter antihistamines, such as diphenhydramine and doxylamine, have anti-nausea effects and are safe to take during pregnancy. Pyridoxine (Vitamin B6) can also help nausea. If your symptoms are more severe, talk to your doctor about a prescription antiemetic (anti-nausea drug).

See a doctor right away if you become dehydrated or dizzy from throwing up too much. Very severe nausea and vomiting in a pregnant woman is called hyperemesis gravidarum, and it should be managed by your doctor.
condition.name: Morning sickness

carousel_items: Reglan can cause drowsiness, so avoid driving and other activities that require you to be alert.
Most doctors prescribe Reglan 4 times a day, 30 minutes before each meal, and before bed.
Don’t drink alcohol or take with other drugs that slow your body down until you know how Reglan affects you.
Contact a doctor immediately if you begin to have repetitive movements of the eyes, tongue, face, arm, or legs.
It can take several weeks before Reglan works best for diabetic gastroparesis; so don’t give up on it.

basics.benefits_moa: Reglan is an antiemetic and prokinetic medication that helps contract and stimulate your stomach. This helps to pass food along, while lowering acid reflux, nausea, and vomiting.
basics.bottom_line: Reglan helps get your digestive system moving and lowers nausea and vomiting. Using it a long time can come with serious, potentially permanent side effects.
downsides: You can’t use Reglan for more than 12 weeks since it can lead to involuntary movements of the eyes, tongue, face, arm, or legs.
Reglan is no longer recommended for acid reflux because of its long list of side effects and the availability of better medications.
It can take several weeks for Reglan to begin working for diabetic gastroparesis.
If you take Reglan for more than 12 weeks, there can be serious side effects and you'll have to get your blood checked often.

downsides_processed.orig: You can’t use Reglan for more than 12 weeks since it can lead to involuntary movements of the eyes, tongue, face, arm, or legs.
Reglan is no longer recommended for acid reflux because of its long list of side effects and the availability of better medications.
It can take several weeks for Reglan to begin working for diabetic gastroparesis.
If you take Reglan for more than 12 weeks, there can be serious side effects and you'll have to get your blood checked often.

upsides: Reglan stops the chance of vomiting for about one-third of the people who take it.
Gets stomach fluids moving after surgery or during diabetic gastroparesis. Works well for acid reflux when other medications don’t.
Comes in a generic version, and in multiple forms.

Gets stomach fluids moving after surgery or during diabetic gastroparesis. Works well for acid reflux when other medications don’t.
Comes in a generic version, and in multiple forms.

userStories.indication: nausea or vomitting caused my morning sickness
userStories.tip: Was glad my pharmacist warned me about diarrhea and tremors as potential side effects.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: I was prescribed Reglan for gastroparesis.  It ended up sending me into a deep, suicidal depression.  A lot of other people have experienced this - I would not recommend taking it unless you have no choice and can be well supervised

drugs.name: Reglan

labeled_indications.indication: Stomach emptying problem caused by diabetes
Nausea and vomiting caused by surgery
Nausea and vomiting caused by chemotherapy

off-label_indications.indication: Stomach emptying problem not caused by diabetes

carousel_items_processed.orig: Reglan can cause drowsiness, so avoid driving and other activities that require you to be alert.
Most doctors prescribe Reglan 4 times a day, 30 minutes before each meal, and before bed.
Don’t drink alcohol or take with other drugs that slow your body down until you know how Reglan affects you.
Contact a doctor immediately if you begin to have repetitive movements of the eyes, tongue, face, arm, or legs.
It can take several weeks before Reglan works best for diabetic gastroparesis; so don’t give up on it.

risks_warnings.title: Abnormal and involuntary muscle movements
risks_warnings.description: Reglan can cause muscle stiffness, feelings of restlessness (like you need to move around), and abnormal or uncontrollable facial or body movements, which could be a sign of tardive dyskinesia (TD). Let your doctor know if you experience any of these symptoms. Reglan should not be taken for more than 12 weeks, because these symptoms can become permanent. There is currently no known effective treatment for TD, although, in some patients TD may go away.

Let your doctor know if you experience any of these symptoms. Reglan should not be taken for more than 12 weeks, because these symptoms can become permanent. There is currently no known effective treatment for TD, although, in some patients TD may go away.

risks_warnings.title: Depression
risks_warnings.description: People taking Reglan can experience symptoms of mental depression. This can occur in people with or without a history of depression.

description_processed.orig: People taking Reglan can experience symptoms of mental depression. This can occur in people with or without a history of depression.

risks_warnings.title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome
risks_warnings.description: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with Reglan. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, stiff muscles, excess sweating, increased heart rate or blood pressure, and confusion. Get medical attention immediately.
